subject: Ye Olde Tie-In
event: And herewith... drum roll, please... the cover art for the new TV tie-in edition of A GAME OF THRONES. Which seems to have lost its "a" but gained the soon-to-be-iconic image of Sean Bean upon HBO's Iron Throne. So much stuff happening on so many fronts of late that I could spend all days posting updates here and still would not catch up. So forgive me if I am late announcing This or talking about That. I do my best, but Kong is a mighty foe. Back to Skull Island.

comments.article:
That really is a great image. There have been people posting pictures from NYC where it's plastered at bus tops and in subway terminals, which is pretty cool. I expect they'll be rolling those out in L.A. and other major metropolitan markets soon enough...

Yesterday also marked the release of the 3rd part of the Maester's Path, HBO's transmedia promotion. This one isn't much of a puzzle, but it's pretty cool to be able to stand atop the Wall and be on the lookout for wildlings. They forgot that it's two blasts of the horns, though...

Nice clip reward, if a brief one, featuring Tyrion, Maester Aemon, and Lord Commander Mormont.

I love the image of Sean Bean on the throne, but I'm curious -- How much input did you have in regards to the design of the throne (and other things)? I mean, it looks great, but of course I imagined something differeng, and I'm cufious about how close this is to your vision.

Regardless, I'm counting the days until the premiere and book release. Yaaaay!! :-)
Keep up the good work.  Godspeed and we'll all be Dancing in July.
Ask them to put the "A" back, at least on the title page if not the cover.  Please.  Librarians will thank you.
Well, damn. Guess I need a third copy... FOURTH if you count my Kindle edition!

I like the image but Ned never really sat on the Iron Throne.

To be fair, no one seems to sit on it very long in the books.
As King's Hand, Ned sat on the Iron Throne in Robert's absence.

Speaking of book covers, I have "A Dance with Dragons" on order from Amazon (since May 2009).  The amazon site now shows a white cover, while it used to show a green cover that matched the style of the yellow, purple, blue, and red covers.  Does anyone know which actual cover I will get? (I'd prefer matching covers - LOL.)

The white one is currently the planned cover for the US publisher. The one with the sword hilt is the UK cover. See GRRM's previous blog entries for pics. The ugly anatomically incorrect dragon covers were scrapped, thankfully.

Folks who have been with the series longer are used to not matching covers since they switched from the foil background of a specific iconic item, to character/scene driven paintings, to the more generic looking icons of the ones you are used to now.

http://www.georgerrmartin.com/gallery/song.html
comments.subject: AdwD cover

comments.article:
Oooo... what should the season 2 book feature?

We could keep the throne motif going with Stanis, Rob, or Tyrion.
Let us say that Sean Bean's posture represents the 'A'.

Hahaha, not everyone can have a picture of Sean Bean on the front of their books, that's pretty awesome.

It does remind me that it's going to be hard reading the books now and not picturing all of the characters as they're portrayed in the show.
If you ignore "new original series from HBO", "#1 New York Times bestselling autor" and "George R.R Martin" you have the "a" in the top left corner!

Not that I don't appreciate the tie-in, but will we still be able to buy the non-tie-in covers?  I keep lending out my copy of AGoT and it somehow never makes it back to me - it's just that good! - so I need to replace it again to re-read the books before the series airs.
As a Barnes & Noble employee, seeing other tie-in covers for other books come and go, my guess is that you'll still be able to buy the other covers.

You cannot wrestle with Kong the whole day, that's true, but are these updates really that important in comparison? I really enjoy them, all, I only think that fans could do without them if you would instead focus on the one thing that is most important right now.
Anyways, you definitely don't need me telling you this and as we have a "hard" release date this time, you'll know what you're doing... but generally, if I could trade updates on side-projects for writing speed on your series, I know what I would do.
/offtopic

The picture is really awesome! I still don't like Sean Bean as Eddard (this one doesn't get newer either) but he sure does attract many viewers - regardless I like the way this cover art is made.
At some point in the future I guess I will have to voice my criticism on certain actors and actresses in certain roles (my biggest concerns are Jon and Cersei... both do not fit - the first looks too soft, the latter is afraid of the person she has to play, therefore cannot), but I will postpone that until I have actually seen them in the series and how they appear there.

However, good luck on finishing Kong and I'm looking forward to April 17 and July 12 - this year is the year of the Song!

As a sculptor (which I realize isn't writing, but it's still a creative medium), I find that when I try to force myself to do NOTHING but the sculpt at hand all day, I get FAR less done, than when I allow myself little breaks to do fun things such as posting to my blog, reading, watching some TV, etc.

If he enjoys writing these updates, they are just as crucial to the completion of Dance as is the actual writing of the book. A brain needs variety. Well, at least mine does. :)
That cover is magnificent, George! Congratulations!
Intellectually I know I don't need another copy of GAME. But, but...SEAN BEAN! *swoons*!

comments.upictitle: Gaspodia, Collector of Shiny Things: pic#118842704
comments.article: If you squint at it from a certain angle, Sean Bean does appear to be striking an "A" pose.
His body would form the missing "A".
comments.subject: If Eddard's sword was across his lap...

comments.upictitle: Jenna: Sugar and spice and all that
comments.article:
Personally I dislike the image but I hate books with tie in covers.

I also am unhappy at the loss of the letter "A." It's the title people! And a great one! Why change it?!
It's Uncle Ned!

Do you think they'll be able to fix it? or are they already printing them without the "A"?

As others have said, I want you to keep wrestling with Kong, but sometimes you need a break and dribbling a little good news feeds us LiveJournal Junkies who keep hitting the "refresh" button to see if you've posted anything new, especially the "I'm Finished" message!
comments.subject: Is this a Final?

comments.article: I collected all of the LOTR movie tie-in books.I shall do the same here.Kong is indeed a mighty foe...

comments.upictitle: [not pictured]: confused pirate-y objection Guybrush surprised
comments.article: Does anyone else think of this at every mention of Skull Island?
Now i'll do every time :D
It's a great pic and I may have to replace my current copy of A Game of Thrones with that edition when it hits the shops. Hope you get rescued from Skull Island soon.
You're always referencing King Kong... I think a GRRM "King Kong" rewrite is in order. Giant ape from Asshai mounts the Eyrie?
Beautiful. I mean, I thought the original covers were the best, but movie tie-in covers are fun, and Sean Bean looks awesome. And oh. My. That throne is truly EPIC.
